Class JIniFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.util.AbstractCollection
        |
        +--java.util.AbstractList
              |
              +--java.util.ArrayList
                    |
                    +--JIniFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Collection, List, RandomAccess, Serializable
public class JIniFile
extends ArrayList

Description:
JIniFile stores and retrieves application-specific information and settings from INI files.

JIniFile enables handling the storage and retrieval of application-specific information and settings in a standard INI file. The INI file text format is a standard introduced in Windows 3.x for storing and retrieving application settings from session to session. An INI file stores information in logical groupings, called "sections." For example, the WIN.INI file contains a section called "[Desktop]". Within each section, actual data values are stored in named keys. Keys take the form:

<keyname>=<value>
A FileName is passed to the JIniFile constructor and identifies the INI file that the object accesses.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Andreas Norman
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JIniFile

public JIniFile(String FileName)
Constructor JIniFile Creates a JIniFile object for an application. Create assigns the FileName parameter to the FileName property, which is used to specify the name of the INI file to use.

Note: By default the INI files are stored in the Application directory. To work with an INI file in another location, specify the full path name of the file in FileName.

Method Detail

ReadSections

public ArrayList ReadSections()
Call ReadSections to retrieve the names of all sections in the INI file into an ArrayList object.

Returns:
an ArrayList holding the sections

UpdateFile

public boolean UpdateFile()
Call UpdateFile to flush buffered reads from and writes to the INI file to disk.

Returns:
returns true if sucessful

ReadString

public String ReadString(String Section,
                         String key,
                         String defaultValue)
Call ReadString to read a string value from an INI file. Section identifies the section in the file that contains the desired key. key is the name of the key from which to retrieve the value. defaultValue is the string value to return if the:
- Section does not exist.
- Key does not exist.
- Data value for the key is not assigned.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
key - the key name
defaultValue - default value if no value is found
Returns:
returns the value. If empty or nonexistent it will return the default value

ReadSectionValues

public ArrayList ReadSectionValues(String Section)
Call ReadSectionValues to read the keys, and the values from all keys, within a specified section of an INI file into an ArrayList object. Section identifies the section in the file from which to read key values.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
Returns:
an ArrayList holding the values in the specified section.

SectionExist

public boolean SectionExist(String Section)
Use SectionExists to determine whether a section exists within the INI file specified in FileName.

Section is the INI file section SectionExists determines the existence of.

SectionExists returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the section in question exists.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
Returns:
returns true if the section exists.

EraseSection

public void EraseSection(String Section)
Call EraseSection to remove a section, all its keys, and their data values from an INI file. Section identifies the INI file section to remove.

Parameters:
Section - the section name

ReadSection

public ArrayList ReadSection(String Section)
Call ReadSection to retrieve the names of all keys within a specified section of an INI file into an ArrayList object.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
Returns:
an ArrayList holding all key names.

ValueExist

public boolean ValueExist(String Section,
                          String key)
Use ValueExist to determine whether a key exists in the INI file specified in FileName.
Section is the section in the INI file in which to search for the key.
key is the name of the key to search for.
ValueExist returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the key exists in the specified section.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
key - the key name
Returns:
returns true if value exists

DeleteKey

public void DeleteKey(String Section,
                      String key)
Call DeleteKey to erase an INI file entry. Section is string containing the name of an INI file section, and key is a string containing the name of the key from for which to set a nil value.

Note: Attempting to delete a key in a nonexistent section or attempting to delete a nonexistent key are not errors. In these cases, DeleteKey does nothing.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
key - the key name

WriteString

public void WriteString(String Section,
                        String key,
                        String value)
Call WriteString to write a string value to an INI file. Section identifies the section in the file that contain the key to which to write. key is the name of the key for which to set a value. value is the string value to write.

Note: Attempting to write a data value to a nonexistent section or attempting to write data to a nonexistent key are not errors. In these cases, WriteString creates the section and key and sets its initial value to value.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
key - the key name
value - the value

WriteBool

public void WriteBool(String Section,
                      String key,
                      boolean value)
Call WriteBool to write a boolean value to an INI file. Section identifies the section in the file that contain the key to which to write. key is the name of the key for which to set a value. value is the boolean value to write.

Note: Attempting to write a data value to a nonexistent section or attempting to write data to a nonexistent key are not errors. In these cases, WriteBool creates the section and key and sets its initial value to value.

Parameters:
Section - the section name
key - the key name
value - the value

                       String key,
                       float value)

Note: Attempting to write a data value to a nonexistent section or attempting to write data to a nonexistent key are not errors. In these cases, WriteFloat creates the section and key and sets its initial value to value.
